plugins.name: Mock Data Generator
plugins.description:
Mock Data Generator is a Figma plugin designed to enhance the design process within Figma by allowing designers to insert realistic mock text data directly into their designs. 


This plugin provides a wide range of data categories and types that can enable you to visualize how your design elements will appear when populated with actual data. 


By using this plugin, you can create more accurate, context-relevant prototypes, to improve the overall user experience and the efficiency of your design iterations.


How to Use the Plugin


  1. Open the Plugin: Start by selecting the text layer in your Figma design that you want to replace with mock data. Then, open the Mock Data Generator plugin from the Figma plugin menu.


  1. Select Category and Data Type: Use the dropdown menus to choose the category of data (e.g., Personal Identification, Professional Information) and then select the specific type of data you need (e.g., First Name, Email Address).


  1. Insert Data: Click the "Replace Selected Text" button to insert the selected mock data into the chosen text layer. If successful, the plugin will notify you that the text has been replaced. If not, it will provide a message prompting you to make the necessary selections.


  1. Review and Iterate: Review the design with the inserted data to ensure it meets your needs. Adjust categories and data types as necessary to simulate different user scenarios and refine your design.
plugins.tagline: Generate high-quality mock text data for your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Figaro Design System Token
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin for Exporting Variables


This Figma plugin simplifies the export of design variables (such as colors, typography, and dimensions) into a structured JSON format. It's ideal for design and development teams aiming to maintain consistency between their Figma design system and codebase.


With this plugin, you can export local variables organized into collections, including details about modes, aliases, and default values, making it easy to integrate them into development workflows like creating design tokens or style systems in CSS or JavaScript.


Features:


Export color, typography, spacing, and more from Figma to JSON.

Support for variable collections and modes (e.g., dark/light mode).

Alias management for consistent use of styles across projects.

Easy integration with development tools to use exported variables in web or mobile projects.

This plugin helps you maintain a robust and scalable design system, seamlessly syncing design variables between Figma and your code.
plugins.tagline: Export Collection Variables

102567.name: Figaro Design System Token

plugins.name: Sunsetter
plugins.description:
Sunsetter is useful for deprecating components before publishing the next version of your design system.


  1. Supports bulk deprecation component sets and components, whether it is made of frames or auto layouts.
  2. Also supports adding your own prefix for the deprecation. If left blank, it uses the default.
  3. Deprecations can also be reversed in bulk. If a custom prefix is used, simply use the prefix and reverse.
  4. Red overlay can be turned off from more options
  5. Add notes with collects writes down deprecation notes in a separate frame
  6. Add _ to all deprecated components without changing any prefixes, just enable in more options


For feedback, please reach out to me on @amohgs

accepted.name: Amogh Srivastava
accepted.description: I love creating things that makes making other things faster

plugins.tagline: Deprecate components in a click

125046.release_notes:
- Added dark mode support
- Add option to hide from publishing (adds underscore before name)
- Added option to create a deprecation notes
- Added option to not turn off using red overlay

plugins.name: Joy UI Theme Export
plugins.description:
This plugin exports a Joy UI theme palette by parsing the Figma variables and comparing to the default Joy UI theme. It will result in a theme object that can be copied and pasted into your code as is, and your code theme will match your Figma theme, eliminating the need for manual updating of theme values in your code.


Coming soon: Github integration to open PR's into your design system with theme changes, with the click of a button!
plugins.tagline: Export Joy UI theme with one click

plugins.name: Jargonator
plugins.description:
Ditch lorem ipsum forever! Jargonator uses AI to generate realistic copy to fit your designs and give it a much more accurate and professional feel. This plugin is integrated with ChatGPT and allows you to precisely control the amount of text generated, including the tone and content. Add detailed direction to the model to fine-tune your text via the settings panel. This AI-powered plugin is so quick and easy at creating realistic text, thereâ€™s no excuse to use lorem ipsum ever again!


Currently this plugin is provided for free by Savas Labs and you are not required to enter your own API key. Once the API costs exceed a certain threshold you may be required to enter your own OpenAI API key in order to continue using this plugin

plugins.name: Responsive variables
plugins.description:
The plugin is designed to streamline the management of typography and sizing variables in responsive design projects. With this plugin, you can efficiently create and manage typography and sizing variables using standardized naming conventions and automate the creation of styles with linked variables.


Demo file https://www.figma.com/community/file/1419690653122064051/responsive-variables-demo


Key Features:


  1. Automatic Variable Creation: Generates typography or sizing variables based on a predefined naming convention.
  2. Linked Styles: Automatically creates text styles with linked variables, ensuring consistency and ease of updates.
  3. Parameter Multipliers: Manages parameters like line-height and letter-spacing using multipliers, allowing the plugin to calculate pixel dimensions.
  4. Style Guide Generation: Automatically create a style guide that's synced with all typography and spacing styles, giving you a quick overview of the design elements. This functionality will generate a new page called "Responsive variables".
  5. Used styles report (beta): This functionality allows users to generate a detailed report listing all the occurrences of different sizes used within a document, providing a comprehensive overview for analysis or optimization purposes


How it works:


  1. When the plugin starts, automatically load all local variables.
  2. The plugin automatically creates a new "Variables" collection where all the variables are stored.
  3. Every time you create a new variable, a text style is automatically created, and all the individual variables are bound to the corresponding property.
  4. Upon plugin load, the plugin generates a fileRefId variable containing a hash. This hash is used as a reference to store ordering data in the pluginâ€™s local storage, ensuring data is kept separate for each file. If you encounter any issues, click the menu icon in the top-right corner of the plugin window and select â€œReset Storage Data.â€
plugins.tagline: Advanced Management of Typography Variables and Sizing for Responsive Design.

128424.name: Responsive variables
128424.description:
The plugin is designed to streamline the management of typography and sizing variables in responsive design projects. With this plugin, you can efficiently create and manage typography and sizing variables using standardized naming conventions and automate the creation of styles with linked variables.


Demo file https://www.figma.com/community/file/1419690653122064051/responsive-variables-demo


Key Features:


  1. Automatic Variable Creation: Generates typography or sizing variables based on a predefined naming convention.
  2. Linked Styles: Automatically creates text styles with linked variables, ensuring consistency and ease of updates.
  3. Parameter Multipliers: Manages parameters like line-height and letter-spacing using multipliers, allowing the plugin to calculate pixel dimensions.
  4. Style Guide Generation: Automatically create a style guide that's synced with all typography and spacing styles, giving you a quick overview of the design elements. This functionality will generate a new page called "Responsive variables".
  5. Used styles report (beta): This functionality allows users to generate a detailed report listing all the occurrences of different sizes used within a document, providing a comprehensive overview for analysis or optimization purposes


How it works:


  1. When the plugin starts, automatically load all local variables.
  2. The plugin automatically creates a new "Variables" collection where all the variables are stored.
  3. Every time you create a new variable, a text style is automatically created, and all the individual variables are bound to the corresponding property.
  4. Upon plugin load, the plugin generates a fileRefId variable containing a hash. This hash is used as a reference to store ordering data in the pluginâ€™s local storage, ensuring data is kept separate for each file. If you encounter any issues, click the menu icon in the top-right corner of the plugin window and select â€œReset Storage Data.â€
128424.release_notes:
* Added an option to rename variables
* Introduced the ability to assign a spacing variable to a specific scope (applies only to new variables).
* Various bug fixes and improvements
128424.tagline: Advanced Management of Typography Variables and Sizing for Responsive Design.

plugins.name: Variables â†’ Text Styles
plugins.description:
Easily Apply Variables to Your Text Styles

Tired of manually assigning variables to text styles? Variables to Text Styles plugin lets you streamline this process by syncing your variables to existing text styles.


How It Works

You'll need existing text styles and typography variables ready to go, then follow these steps:


  1. Create text objects
  2. Apply variables to the text layers' properties
  3. Name the text layers to match their corresponding text style. If your styles are in folders, include the full path using '/' (e.g., folder/subfolder/style)
  4. Run the plugin
  5. Select your text layers. If you make changes, you'll need to reselect them.
  6. Click "Update Text Styles" to apply the variables


Important Notes

  1. If you modify your text properties while the plugin is open, reselect them to refresh the updates.
  2. This plugin does not convert text layers into styles, allowing you to continue making adjustments.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer â€¢ Plugin Author â€¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Sync variables with your text styles.

131969.name: Variables â†’ Text Styles
131969.description:

How It Works

You'll need existing text styles and typography variables ready to go, then follow these steps:


  1. Create text objects
  2. Apply variables to the text layers' properties
  3. Name the text layers to match their corresponding text style. If your styles are in folders, include the full path using '/' (e.g., folder/subfolder/style)
  4. Run the plugin
  5. Select your text layers. If you make changes, you'll need to reselect them.
  6. Click "Update Text Styles" to apply the variables


Important Notes

  1. If you modify your text properties while the plugin is open, reselect them to refresh the updates.
  2. This plugin does not convert text layers into styles, allowing you to continue making adjustments.
131969.tagline: Sync variables with your text styles.

plugins.name: Gridify
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for Figma that allows you to quickly and easily generate the three most common viewports and grids for each device, perfect for any design project you start from scratch.


Functionality:

â€¢Creates viewports for the 3 main viewports, adding grid styles to each frame.

â€¢Mobile (4 columns, type: stretch, margin: 24, gutter: 20)

â€¢Tablet (8 columns, type: stretch, margin: 32, gutter: 30)

â€¢Desktop (12 columns, type: center, width: 65, gutter: 30)


Contact and support:

If you have any questions, suggestions, or improvements, chat with me:

jcrocco@mindtrust.com
plugins.tagline: Create main viewports for web design

plugins.name: 8pt Grid Align
plugins.description:
8pt Grid Align eliminates the tedious task of aligning designs to an 8-point grid. A simple, no-fuss solution to amplify your design workflow.

  1. Instantly snap objects and round object measurements to the 8pt grid with one click.
  2. Scale proportionally, while keeping stroke weights intact.
  3. Quickly apply preset container sizes and grid widths for common screen sizes.
  4. Use the lock ratio option for precise resizing and scaling.


If aligning to 8-point grid divisions feels like a chore, this plugin will save you time and make your layouts cleaner and more consistent.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly align and scale your designs to the 8-point grid with precision and ease.

  3. Quickly apply preset container sizes and grid widths for common screen sizes.
  4. Use the lock ratio option for precise resizing and scaling.


If aligning to 8-point grid divisions feels like a chore, this plugin will save you time and make your layouts cleaner and more consistent.
115389.release_notes: Fixed some quick scale quirks and refined some code
115389.tagline: Effortlessly align and scale your designs to the 8-point grid with precision and ease.

This plugin is part of a series of plugins with pure focus on elevating little things we designers need! and a form of giving back to the design community -xOxO
100654.tagline: Get that count in a sec!

plugins.name: pixelbrush
plugins.description:
Pixelbrush allows you to quickly draw, pixel by pixel. Because every pixel drawn is a square, these drawings can easily be resized, copied, and manipulated with Figma's default selection tools.


Basic undo is supported. This plugin provides an earthy palette of 6 colors by default, but users can now use their own custom palette's by creating and selecting a set of squares with colors of their choice and then pressing the "select button" in the pixelbrush interface!


Tips:

  1. If you are having trouble finding the square or the plugin behavior is unresponsive try pressing "reset"
  2. If this fails, try exiting out of the plugin and restarting it with option + command + p.
  3. rasterize large pixel art to make copying it more performant.
  4. Option + drag is a great way to create patterns.
plugins.tagline: Create and manipulate pixel art

112648.name: pixelbrush
112648.description:

Basic undo is supported. This plugin provides an earthy palette of 6 colors by default, but users can now use their own custom palette's by creating and selecting a set of squares with colors of their choice and then pressing the "select button" in the pixelbrush interface!


Tips:

  2. If this fails, try exiting out of the plugin and restarting it with option + command + p.
  3. rasterize large pixel art to make copying it more performant.
  4. Option + drag is a great way to create patterns.
112648.release_notes: - Added color selection button and functionality

plugins.name: Airtable Connect
plugins.description:
The plugin allows data from Airtable to be mapped to the layers of Figma components. This functionality is especially useful for designers looking to streamline their workflow and maximize efficiency. With this plugin, it is possible to generate multiple design variations in a matter of seconds, eliminating the need for manual adjustments one by one.


By integrating Airtable with Figma, designers can import structured data directly into their design files. For example, if you have a table in Airtable with different content versions for a marketing campaign, you can assign this data to text and image elements in your Figma components. This not only saves time but also reduces the risk of errors when copying and pasting information.


Furthermore, the plugin is highly versatile and can be used in a variety of projects, from creating user interface prototypes to generating personalized graphic material. Its intuitive use does not require advanced knowledge, making it accessible to both beginner and experienced designers.


In summary, this plugin transforms the way we work with data and design, providing an efficient and effective solution for creating dynamic and adaptable designs.


https://airtable-connect.livingcrowdland.com/
plugins.tagline: The plugin maps Airtable data to Figma layers, enabling quick creation of multiple design variations

In summary, this plugin transforms the way we work with data and design, providing an efficient and effective solution for creating dynamic and adaptable designs.

plugins.name: Airsync - Sync from Airtable to Figma
plugins.description:
Airsync access is invite-only and is restricted to select users approved by Tekion.


Airsync connects your Figma project to Airtable, simplifying the process of making content changes. Itâ€™s primarily made for product stakeholders, reducing time and effort required to make content alterations in Figma.


Directly edit text or change images in an Airtable base, and the changes will automatically reflect in the linked Figma project. Itâ€™s straightforward and practical, designed to enhance the workflow and minimize manual work.


For any suggestions or feedback, please reach out to Shaan Shivanandan.

plugins.name: Logo Light
plugins.description:
Transform Color Logos to Clean White Versions


Logo Light is a powerful Figma plugin that quickly converts any color logo or image into a clean, professional white version with transparent backgroundâ€”perfect for dark backgrounds, presentations, and mockups.


Key Features

âœ¨ Instant Transformation - Convert any color logo to white with a single click

ðŸ–¼ï¸ Supports All Image Formats - Works with JPEG, PNG, SVG, and any other image format in Figma

ðŸ“¤ PNG Output - Creates clean PNG files with transparency for maximum flexibility

ðŸŽ›ï¸ Advanced Controls - Fine-tune the result with contrast and threshold adjustments

ðŸ” Preview - See your white logo in real-time against a dark background

ðŸŽ¯ Multiple Modes - Choose from three conversion methods for perfect results:


Luminance - Best for detailed logos with gradients

Silhouette - Ideal for solid logos and simple shapes

Threshold - Perfect for high-contrast conversion with clean edges


Why You Need This Plugin

Designers frequently need white logo versions for dark mode interfaces, mockups, and presentations. Instead of manually tracing or recreating logos, Logo Light automates this process with precise results in seconds. It works with any image format, including JPEG files that typically don't support transparency, and outputs clean PNGs with transparent backgrounds.

How to Use


Select any image or logo in your Figma document (JPEG, PNG, SVG, etc.)

Click "Generate Logo" in the plugin

Adjust settings to perfect the result

Click "Create in Figma" to add the white version to your document


The generated white logo maintains the exact proportions of your original and is placed right next to it for easy access.

Perfect For


Creating dark mode versions of websites and apps

Converting JPEGs and other non-transparent formats to clean white PNGs

Designing presentation templates with consistent branding

Building mockups with white logo variations

Preparing press kits with logo alternatives

Maintaining brand asset libraries with all logo variants


Feedback and Support

We're constantly improving Logo Light based on user feedback. If you have suggestions, encounter any issues, or need assistance, please reach out to us via our support email or website.

Transform your logos in seconds with Logo Light â€” the essential tool for every designer's toolkit!
plugins.tagline: Transform color logos to white with a single click

plugins.name: Knak - Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
Turn Figma Designs into Production-Ready HTMLâ€”In Seconds


The Knak - Figma Plugin helps Marketing Designers bring their Figma designs into Knak and turn them into fully editable emailsâ€”without having to start from scratch. Instead of manually rebuilding designs, you can import them directly into Knak, refine the details, and create reusable modules and themes that fit into your workflows.


With this plugin, you can:

âœ… Speed up Design-to-Production Workflow

âœ… Transform Figma designs into Knak HTML in secondsâ€”no manual handoffs, no back-and-forth.

âœ… Keep Designers in Figma

âœ… Let designers stay in the tool they love while keeping every email on-brand. Push designs to Knak with one click, ensuring a smooth handoff that preserves brand guidelines and creative integrity.

âœ… Make it easier for Marketing Operations to review and finalize designs.


How it works


1 - Design in Figma

  1. Create email layouts using the Knak - Figma Plugin.

2 - Sync to Knak

  1. Push designs directly into Knakâ€™s no-code builder with a single click.

3 - Refine & Launch

  1. Fine-tune, personalize, and translate in Knak, then send directly to your marketing automation platform.


Read the step-by-step guide here.


Need help? Visit our help centre.

plugins.tagline: Move your Figma designs into Knak and get emails across the finish line, fast.

plugins.name: Color AutoUpdater
plugins.description:
ðŸš€ Color AutoUpdater is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly keeping your design colors in check! Say goodbye to manually updating frame backgrounds and hello to automation.


âœ¨ What it does:


ðŸ” Scans all frames on the current page for text nodes with valid hex color codes.

ðŸŽ¨ Updates frame backgrounds to match the detected hex color code.

ðŸŒ“ Ensures text readability by switching text to white on dark backgrounds and black on light backgrounds.

ðŸ§¼ Sets default colors (white background, black text) for frames without a color code, ensuring a clean and consistent look.


ðŸ› ï¸ How to use it:


Select the Page: Open your Figma file and navigate to the page you want to update.

Automatic Update: The plugin scans all frames on the page and updates background colors based on the hex codes found in text nodes.

Review Changes: Frames with valid hex codes will have their backgrounds updated and text colors adjusted. Frames without hex codes will have a default white background and black text.


âš ï¸ Relevant limitations:


The plugin supports only 6-character hex color codes (e.g., #FFFFFF).

It works on the current page only, so run it separately for each page in your Figma file.

Frames without color codes will be set to a white background and black text, which might override custom defaults set by the user.

ðŸ’¡ With Color AutoUpdater, maintain a polished and consistent design effortlessly, saving you time and ensuring color accuracy and readability. Try it now and elevate your design workflow! ðŸŒŸ
plugins.tagline: update frame background colors based on color codes

plugins.name: RealSize Plugin
plugins.description:
RealScale is a Figma plugin that allows designers to view their designs at real-world size directly on the canvas. It automatically scales the viewport based on the PPI (pixels per inch) of your display, giving you an accurate representation of how your designs will appear on real devices. Simply install the plugin, select a layer and run the plugin.


How to use:

  1. Select a layer
  2. Activate the RealScale plugin.
  3. Enter the display details (resolution and screen size).
  4. Enter the target display details.
  5. Enjoy viewing your design in true-to-life dimensions!


Note: No subscription required.

accepted.name: Fail Fast
accepted.description: Digital experience design studio with +90 creatives. Embracing fearless innovation, we ideate, prototype, test, and learn without fear of failing.

plugins.tagline: Scale your designs to real size instantly.

plugins.name: Utopia Spacers
plugins.description:
The Utopia Spacers plugin uses the Utopia Fluid Space Calculator to generate a variable collection of number variables across a variety of comp size modes.


How to Use

  1. Visit Utopia.fyi and create a system of spacers using their fluid space calculator linked above.
  2. By default, spacers are only shown at their min and max size. To use this plugin, add one or more custom viewport sized by clicking the black + in the top right of the calculator's calculated values (see images).
  3. Once you're happy with your system, copy and paste the URL into the plugin. A new set of variables called "Utopia Spacers" will generate in your Local Variables.
  4. Use the spacers as normal variables. If you need to update values or add sizes, you can update the calculator and copy/paste the new, updated URL to bring in your changes.


Tips

  • Make sure the first viewport you enter is the size you'll be designing in (we use 1440px).
  • If you have a Starter Figma account, you're limited to only 1 mode. If you have a Professional or Organization level account you can use up to 4 modes. Enterprise accounts can use up to 40 modes.
  • We use 390px for mobile, 768 for tablet, 1440 for desktop, and 2560 for XL desktop.
  • Make sure to save your most-current Utopia URL somewhere so you can reference it easily.

accepted.name: Kylie LaCour
accepted.description: Enthusiast of elegant digital systems, dedicated advocate of fluid responsive design, and novice creator of plugins.

plugins.tagline: Generate a variable collection of fluid responsive spacers based on the Utopia.fyi design system.

81113.name: Utopia Spacers
81113.description:
The Utopia Spacers plugin uses the Utopia Fluid Space Calculator to generate a variable collection of number variables across a variety of comp size modes.

  2. By default, spacers are only shown at their min and max size. To use this plugin, add one or more custom viewport sized by clicking the black + in the top right of the calculator's calculated values (see images).
  3. Once you're happy with your system, copy and paste the URL into the plugin. A new set of variables called "Utopia Spacers" will generate in your Local Variables.
  4. Use the spacers as normal variables. If you need to update values or add sizes, you can update the calculator and copy/paste the new, updated URL to bring in your changes.


Tips

  • Make sure the first viewport you enter is the size you'll be designing in (we use 1440px).
  • If you have a Starter Figma account, you're limited to only 1 mode. If you have a Professional or Organization level account you can use up to 4 modes. Enterprise accounts can use up to 40 modes.
  • We use 390px for mobile, 768 for tablet, 1440 for desktop, and 2560 for XL desktop.
  • Make sure to save your most-current Utopia URL somewhere so you can reference it easily.
81113.tagline: Generate a variable collection of fluid responsive spacers based on the Utopia.fyi design system.

plugins.name: Radix Colos as figma variables
plugins.description:
Here is the first version of Radix colors as Figma variables. Beta.


Radix Colors - "A gorgeous, accessible color system for user interfaces"


This plugin is a simple way for you to get any of the Radix colors as variables into a variable collection from any of your files.


The plugin allows you to:

  1. add any color to a preferred variable collection
  2. add solid or alpha variants
  3. choose light or dark values for single mode collections
  4. add both light and dark values as modes for multimode collections (Figma paid seat is required for variable modes)
  5. (soon) add a custom color created in radix web ui
  6. set-up a new variable collection with 2 modes
  7. choose your own collection where to put the variables
  8. choose your ow light and dark modes from the collection


INFO: The plugin is functional, but the user guide and error handling are not done yet. I am releasing it as i is for now so everybody can use the current feature set that covers most of the intended feature set


In order for the plugin to function, you need to go to settings and:

  1. select a mode of operation
  2. select or create a variable collection. It can be renamed at any time in the Figma UI
  3. select variable modes where the values will land. (They can also be renamed at any time)


Settings are saved as you select them.

Known bug: When you create a new collection, you need to close and reopen the settings page to reflect the changes, or press the refresh button.


This was mostly developed in coffee shops. I hope you see where i'm going with this... ðŸ˜†


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/bogris
plugins.tagline: add Radix colors as Figma variables intou your collection

plugins.name: Tuned Variables
plugins.description:
Tuned Variables

A Figma plugin for creating simple mathmatical expressions with local variables


ðŸ”¥ Features:

  • Create values based on simple mathmatical expressions
  • Use other variables as values for an expression
  • Reference variables from other groups
  • Reference variables from other collections


ðŸš€ How to use:

  1. In a variable, update its description with an expression like so: {{ 2 + 2 }}
  2. In the menu bar, click on the plugin, and it will run through all your variables and update their values if an expression is set.
  3. To use other variables as values reference them like so: {{ $base * 2 }}. This will take the value from the value with the name base
  4. To use nested variables simply use their name: {{ $Font/Size/base * 2}}. This will take the value base from the group Size inside the group Font
  5. To use variables from other collections prepend the variable name with the collection name. Example: If you have a collection called primitives then write it like so $primitives/Font/Size/base - this will get the variable Font/Size/base inside the primitives collection


ðŸš§ Limitations:

Only Number variables at the moment

Modes are isolated, so you can't use a variable value from another mode.

Only simple operators are supported: *, /, +, -


ðŸŽ Contribute:

If you want to improve the plugin, then you are very welcome to create a PR


ðŸ¤ License:

This will stay forever free and you are welcome to use this in personal and business use.


ðŸ’Ž Need more advanced featues?

I don't have plans to make this plugin more advanced, so if you need more advanced features i would recommend you to check out the Dynamic Variables by @neelts
plugins.tagline: Reference other variables and create simple calculations for dynamic values

92441.name: Tuned Variables
92441.description:
Tuned Variables

A Figma plugin for creating simple mathmatical expressions with local variables


ðŸ”¥ Features:

  • Create values based on simple mathmatical expressions
  • Use other variables as values for an expression
  • Reference variables from other groups
  • Reference variables from other collections


ðŸš€ How to use:

  1. In a variable, update its description with an expression like so: {{ 2 + 2 }}
  2. In the menu bar, click on the plugin, and it will run through all your variables and update their values if an expression is set.
  3. To use other variables as values reference them like so: {{ $base * 2 }}. This will take the value from the value with the name base
  4. To use nested variables simply use their name: {{ $Font/Size/base * 2}}. This will take the value base from the group Size inside the group Font
  5. To use variables from other collections prepend the variable name with the collection name. Example: If you have a collection called primitives then write it like so $primitives/Font/Size/base - this will get the variable Font/Size/base inside the primitives collection


ðŸš§ Limitations:

Only Number variables at the moment

Modes are isolated, so you can't use a variable value from another mode.

Only simple operators are supported: *, /, +, -


ðŸŽ Contribute:

If you want to improve the plugin, then you are very welcome to create a PR


ðŸ¤ License:

This will stay forever free and you are welcome to use this in personal and business use.


ðŸ’Ž Need more advanced featues?

I don't have plans to make this plugin more advanced, so if you need more advanced features i would recommend you to check out the Dynamic Variables by @neelts
92441.release_notes:
Added support for cross collections support
Added support for variables referencing other variables referencing other variables and so forth.
92441.tagline: Reference other variables and create simple calculations for dynamic values

plugins.name: cmd-c - Generate HTML and Tailwind code
plugins.description:
cmd-c generates HTML and Tailwind code similar to your handwritten code.


It converts both Auto Layout and Absolute Positioned (Vector-Based) UI into Flex Positioned code.


cmd-c also generates semantically correct HTML by identifying the content (e.g., p, span, img, video) and interactive elements (e.g., button, a).


Our goal at cmd-c is to create the best developer handoff tool, allowing developers to focus on building what truly matters.
plugins.tagline: AI that generates handwritten tailwind code from your Figma designs.

95404.name: cmd-c - Generate HTML and Tailwind code
95404.description:
cmd-c generates HTML and Tailwind code similar to your handwritten code.


It converts both Auto Layout and Absolute Positioned (Vector-Based) UI into Flex Positioned code.


cmd-c also generates semantically correct HTML by identifying the content (e.g., p, span, img, video) and interactive elements (e.g., button, a).


Our goal at cmd-c is to create the best developer handoff tool, allowing developers to focus on building what truly matters.
95404.release_notes: - Removed login and made the plugin more accessible.
95404.tagline: AI that generates handwritten tailwind code from your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Scaffolder
plugins.description:
Scaffolder sets up the pages that are in a project based on a proven formula for small, large and enterprise design systems. You can choose one of 4 options.


Small Project (Design + Style Hints)

Includes pages for mood board, style hints, designs, research, and components. This type is for small projects that don't need a full style guide.


Large Project (Design + Style Guide)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, designs, research, and components. This type is for large projects that need a full style guide as well as multiple application modules/areas.


Enterprise Project (Design)

Includes pages for designs and research. This type is for enterprise projects that not only needs a style guide, but also needs to separate the design system, guide, and components from the page designs. This is meant to be used along with the 'Enterprise Project (Theme)' type.


Enterprise Project (Theme)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, and components. This type is used to build out the style guide, design system, and components that will be used with the 'Enterprise Project (Design)' file.


Note: Once you run the plugin, do not run it again or you might get duplicate pages. It will not remove existing pages except for the initial, default page.
plugins.tagline: Scaffolds project page setup for quick, consistent design file.

73036.name: Scaffolder
73036.description:

Large Project (Design + Style Guide)

Enterprise Project (Design)

Includes pages for designs and research. This type is for enterprise projects that not only needs a style guide, but also needs to separate the design system, guide, and components from the page designs. This is meant to be used along with the 'Enterprise Project (Theme)' type.


Enterprise Project (Theme)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, and components. This type is used to build out the style guide, design system, and components that will be used with the 'Enterprise Project (Design)' file.


Note: Once you run the plugin, do not run it again or you might get duplicate pages. It will not remove existing pages except for the initial, default page.
73036.tagline: Scaffolds project page setup for quick, consistent design file.

plugins.name: ChromaCraft
plugins.description: This Figma plugin allows users to select a single element on the canvas. It analyzes the color of the selected element and determines whether it's a light or dark color. Based on this analysis, it generates a new color that is either darker or lighter and creates a visual representation of this new color beside the selected element. The plugin also takes care of font loading and positioning the new color representation appropriately.
plugins.tagline: ColorShift: Enhance with Dynamic Color Combinations

63279.name: ChromaCraft
63279.description: This Figma plugin allows users to select a single element on the canvas. It analyzes the color of the selected element and determines whether it's a light or dark color. Based on this analysis, it generates a new color that is either darker or lighter and creates a visual representation of this new color beside the selected element. The plugin also takes care of font loading and positioning the new color representation appropriately.
63279.tagline: ColorShift: Enhance with Dynamic Color Combinations

plugins.name: FlowConnect - Figjam Connectors in Figma
plugins.description:
FlowConnect: Connectors that are smart and seamless


FlowConnect brings Figjam-style connectors to Figma, making it easy to link frames and create flows. With smart positioning that automatically adjusts when you move elements, customizable arrow styles, and simple text labels, you can quickly create clean user flows and sitemaps. Connect your frames with just a few clicks and let FlowConnect handle the rest.


Key Features :


âœ¦ Figjam-style connectors: Create connections between frames with real-time visual feedback

âœ¦ Smart positioning: Connectors find the best connection points and auto-reroute when frames move

âœ¦ Advanced styling options: Customize line types, stroke weights, dash patterns, and opacity

âœ¦ Text labels: Add descriptive text to your connections that update automatically

âœ¦ Live preview: See how your connections will look before you create them

âœ¦ Multiple arrow styles: Choose from lines, triangles, diamonds, and circles for both connector ends

âœ¦ Offset controls: Fine-tune connection points for perfect placement along frame edges


Premium Features :


âœ¦ Custom Color Connectors

âœ¦ Shapes - Future

âœ¦ Set Presets

âœ¦ More on the Roadmap.


How to use :

  1. Connecter is Pre copied already, You can just Ctrl/Cmd + V in you canvas to get started, If no press the copy button on top and paste them in canvas [One time Thing].
  2. Select any two objects and click Link objects to connect them using a connector styled according to your preferences.
plugins.tagline: Connectors that are smart and seamless

plugins.name: Pixel Magic
plugins.description:
Transform your images into eye-catching pixel art with Pixel, the ultimate Figma plugin for pixel enthusiasts! Whether you're crafting retro aesthetics or exploring unique design styles, Pixie offers endless possibilities for creativity.


Why Use Pixel Pixie?

  1. Custom Backgrounds: Set your own background color to complement your design perfectly.
  2. Adjustable Precision: Control size for the ideal level of detail in your artwork.
  3. Pixel Shapes: Choose from various pixel shapes (squares, circles, and semi-circle) to customize your pixel art style.
  4. Export Type: Choose to export the pixelated effect as either an image or a group of nodes.


Designed for designers, artists, and creative minds, Pixie lets you reimagine your visuals in stunning pixelated forms. Discover how this versatile plugin can bring a bold new dimension to your designs.


Important Note:

  1. For node based export, the time to export depends based on number of nodes.
  2. It is better to not have huge number of nodes for better performance


Feedback & Support:

I'd love to see what you've created using this plugin! Feel free to tag me or say hi on X/Twitter (@HarshithAshvi). Your feedback and bug reports are always welcome ðŸ™


Contact:

Email: astroashvi@gmail.com

X/Twitter: https://x.com/HarshithAshvi
plugins.tagline: Images to pixel effect

plugins.name: Figma Network
plugins.description: Figgy Network is a geo-based network enabling users to connect, share ideas, collaborate on projects, follow interests, and advertise services locally, fostering community engagement, innovation, and opportunities tailored to specific locations.
plugins.tagline: connect, share, collaborate, follow, advertise, hub, community, nest, network, social
